page.title: 14Alfriston Church
page.content:
The parish church of St Andrew, Alfriston stands next to the River Cuckmere. It was built in 1360 in the shape of a Greek Cross. Unlike many churches there have been no major additions to the original design. The Church is built from local flints and is considered a fine example of a building in flint.
Its size has gained it the reputation of the Cathedral of the Downs. It has a fine shingled brooch spire in the centre of the church and lofty 14th Century arches. Notable features include a richly decorated sedilia and beautiful Easter Sepulchre.
The church has 6 bells which are rung from the centre floor of the church,a sight which is of great interest to visitors.
